Reviews.Title: “INCREDIBLE! GREAT VIEWS -WONDERFUL ACCOMODATIONS!”
Reviews.Author: biker2x2
Reviews.Content: We traveled with another couple by motorcycle from West Palm Beach to Key West! Upon our arrival at the Travelodge Suites in Key West we were greeted with a friendly front desk with a very accommodating attitude…!. Then the incredible experience the ‘suite’ extremely clean – full facility,(kitchen-washer dryer) 3 bedrooms- swimming pool- And balconies facing on one side the water – a step out from the bedroom or kitchenette- upstairs more ................ Spectacular views of Key West! We were all (4 of us) more than pleased by the Travelodge Key West! Going to Key West???? Stay here!!! Quiet custom sound-proof doors- spectacular view of the sunset- and in general- a very relaxing stay- the hotel is 'older' but what isn't in Key West???

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: LuvenLife
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Travelodge for one night while we traveled to Key West. We stayed in a 3 bedroom suite. It was very spacious with 2 balconies and had a full kitchen even a washer and dryer which was nice. The hotel is very dated, but the view makes up for it. We sat on our ocean front patio for breakfast and enjoyed the weather. The pool is very nice and the free breakfast adds a nice touch. The front desk staff was very nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “What a surprise!”
Reviews.Author: moocow34
Reviews.Content: I travel frequently for work and I have to admit that I avoid Travelodge like the plague. A friend of mine and I decided to go to Key West for a long weekend on a whim and I booked this hotel as a rewards stay because it was one of the few available that did not have bed bug reports. WOW, what a nice surprise. We stayed in a two bedroom king suite and it was amazing! True, it is a Travelodge and a little bit older property and could use a little maintenance and some paint, but the rooms were clean and the beds were comfortable. Our suite was HUGE with two bedrooms with separate baths, living room with tv, two patios (one facing the gulf and one facing Key West), full kitchen and washer and dryer. The appliances were a little older and beat up, but they worked just fine. We stayed here for three nights and then were checking out to go to a "nicer" hotel for the rest of our trip and I have to admit we didn't want to leave the Travelodge! It's a little far from Key West, but the pool and hot tub are great, parking is free and the view of the gulf is fantastic. The staff was so amazingly friendly - especially since I was staying on a rewards stay and not paying, I have been treated really rudely by other Wyndam chain hotels in the past when staying on a rewards stay. I can honestly say that this will be my hotel for every future trip to Key West!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise in Key West”
Reviews.Author: LawnRanger69
Reviews.Content: We used Wyndham Rewards Points (Level 4 16000) to book one night here. The 2 bedroom suite had a full kitchen with washer and dryer. Older appliances but everything worked fine. The 2nd bedroom is up a set of winding stairs but very spacious. Bathrooms were up to date. View north was fantastic and you can view both sunset and sunrise this time of year from the unit. Not noisy even though the highway runs in front. Pool was very pleasant. Slept well. Breakfast was coffee, cereal, bagels, muffins that were okay. One waffle maker was busy most of the time.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable mid budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: DrasanWales
Reviews.Content: A reasonable mid budget hotel which is clean and tidy with a nice pool area but a little way outside the centre of town. Good views from the more expensive ocean front rooms. There are a range of eateries within walking distance. Good overnight accommodation with free internet and an acceptable complimentary breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Did not get a room, but very accommodating!”
Reviews.Author: boxofrain80
Reviews.Content: My friend and I decided on a whim to drive to Key West for New Year's Eve, however we discovered when we got there that there were no rooms ANYWHERE on the whole island, or for over 90miles away. The staff at the front desk were more than accommodating - they offered to make phone calls for us to other hotels, and gave us advice on how we might find a room later in the night at other places if reservations were not upheld. In the end, we could not find a room, however - the staff there were so nice, they let us use their bathroom to freshen up at night, and again in the morning while we slept in our car. They were just the nicest, most understanding people. I would gladly stay in their hotel if they only had a room :) !!

Reviews.Title: “OK for KW”
Reviews.Author: BluesTraveler91
Reviews.Content: Clean, inexpenisive,(for Key West),nothing fancy. good place to rest your head.

Reviews.Title: “Great find!”
Reviews.Author: speakergirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights in December 2011 and would recommend it. Key West is known for being overpriced,but this hotel was very reasonable and because of this, we were a bit concerned about booking it,but we are glad that we took the chance. Yes, it could be doing with a bit of updating, but the rooms we booked (a two bedroom suite) were large, comfortable and, most importantly, clean. We had a great view over the sea and although the road outside is busy, we didn't really notice the traffic noise. Breakfast is continental style, but plenty of it and was fresh every day. Staff were helpful and pleasant. Would definitely recommend and will return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Hits the spot”
Reviews.Author: PremiumQueen
Reviews.Content: Ont he main road into the centre of Key West but don't let that put you off as the road is quiet. Hotel has pool that is welcoming after day of sight seeing, breakfast is just buffet nothing hot apart from coffee! Rooms are not that big but sufficient if only there for sleeping! We would stay there again when in the Keys.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in Key West”
Reviews.Author: jammex88
Reviews.Content: Located about 15 min drive outside of the center of Key West. Very easy to find, right on the main road. Free parking and good prices, so a great value for overpriced KW. Hotel itself is not fancy but gets the job done. Continental breakfast is so-so but has the basics. You will get a good nights sleep because the area is quiet compared to the hectic center.

Reviews.Title: “RUDE & ROBBED!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Dave C
Reviews.Content: One employee in particular...Alex was sarcastic and rude when we asked him about moving the continental breakfast trash to nearer the food. Then asked to get a wastebasket for one bathroom in our suite.. After a long verbal struggle we got the wastebasket... Found out when packing that we were ROBBED!!!. A leather jacket from the rear of a closet was taken. getting NOWHERE with management..CANNOT EVEN GET A CALL BACK!!!! Will never go here again!!!! Contacting Chamber of Commerce, and BBB for complaint, and Travelodge corporate!!!

Reviews.Title: “Robbed!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lucididee
Reviews.Content: I had no complaints until my last night @ the Travelodge in KW. When I got back to my room, I found out we were robbed! The room was NOT ransacked. Suitcase with clothes, purse with all my ID, camera equipment, video camera, laptop, Jewelry and even 2 bottles of wine were taken from the refrigerator. Getting NO cooperation from the hotel staff I visit KW once a year for the boat races and will never stay here again

Reviews.Title: “This place was great”
Reviews.Author: Michele B
Reviews.Content: Great views, large rooms, balcony to hang out on, convenient location. This is a well-kept property. They throw breakfast in to boot. When you come in the staff acknowledges you. Each morning staff were so pleasant. If you need anything they are there for you right away. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “DISGUSTING”
Reviews.Author: mylittlepony21
Reviews.Content: The hotel pictures looked decent and the price wasn't bad, I read some bad reviews but figured they were just from angry customers. When we got to our VERY small room there was an overwhelming musty smell of mold. The front desk upgraded us to a suite which was very spacious but dirty. Our socks/feet were black after walking around for 5 minutes. The washing machine had a very foul smell in it. We had to stand and hold the handle down until the toilet flushed completely. Then to top it off I brought breakfast back to the room and placed it on the counter, and noticed there were very tiny black bugs on the counter. We were disgusted. We stayed at the Inn at Key West the next night (for $40 more per night but SO worth it) in the morning I realized I forgot a pair of shoes in our Travelodge room. We went by there and the manager brought us to the room (which had new guests in it) She went in the bedroom and lifted up the bedskirt...my shoes were there,meaning under the beds don't get cleaned. Save your money and stay somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location, Convenient Amenities, Great View”
Reviews.Author: fyrmun37
Reviews.Content: Travelodge Key West was very spacious, clean, convenient with a great view and wonderful staff. It was a quick $15 dollar cab ride to Duval for FantasyFest, and we saved some money to spend on drinks by having breakfast and lunch at the hotel, with a view overlooking the pool and the Gulf of Mexico. The balcony was as spacious as the living area was!!

Reviews.Title: “Run!!! This place is horrible!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jwint416
Reviews.Content: As we walked into our room here at the travelodge we were hit in the face by a strong mold odor. To compensate us the guest services upgraded us to a not so crappy room. Needless to say that this room is no better, just a little more spacious. Also because we were unable to stay in the first room, due to the smell, we were told that we have to go else were a day before we leave. We were up all nite trying to find another place but it's looking like 500 dollars for one nite!! Because of this hotel I will never stay at another travelodge!!

Reviews.Title: “Just right”
Reviews.Author: Susan F
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our recent trip to Key West for 1 night. We just had a one bed room and the room is small but we were hardly in the room. Great for sleeping and showering and then on to the next sight. Clean, comfortable, great breakfast. Located in New Key West so you really can't walk to Old Key West. But we just drove down to the see the historic sites.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: philip a
Reviews.Content: We had two rooms . Rooms were clean and had all the things for a normal stay. There are no windows or views. I don't think there was a bar in the place.Breakfast is just average .The employees seems pleasant. Just an average place for sleeping and if you want to have fun go to beach or duval street!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best in the keys”
Reviews.Author: Anthony R
Reviews.Content: This has to be the best in the keys. We came in to go to & plan a wedding. Had trouble with air in our suite & were immediatly moved & upgraded for our troubles. Everything & more that we read & saw in pictures & reviews was provided. We knew in advance that downtown was a little distance away & accomadated for that. Service was very good & rooms were clean but smaller than expected. Had a second party from the family staying there & they also feel the same.

Reviews.Title: “I'm not picky but I do NOT recommend this place!”
Reviews.Author: snetzel
Reviews.Content: Breakfast was ok but VERY small eating room. "Tiki bar" was closed. Just an empty tiki bar at the pool.... HUH? you teasing us or what? Wifi at the pool was so poor it just interfered with streaming music. Had to turn off wifi on my phone. If you do connect in the room then turn your phone off, you get nagged every time you turn your phone on. As mentioned before, carpets were filthy and made our feet BLACK. The bed had a 2X4 under it proppping up the middle. Nice. It was quite small, looks like this room used to be an add on to what was a time share condo. I haven't even touched on the worst yet!!!!! These people don't do anything about unruly people.... 1) my wife and I were sitting by the pool one night. A family came down there and their 4 children were out of control. 2 outside the pool dragging the other 2 in the pool by the life preserver and the other by the rope. An attendant came down and had the audacity to tell US the pool was closing, turned their back to the commotion in the pool and proceeded to straighten up the chairs without telling the hoodlums to STOP! Now, the best for last.... There was a HUGE party next to us. When I say huge I mean pounding on the walls, screaming. loud music, underage kids all over outside and a strong smell of pot all around 11 - midnight. We (mistakenly) called the front desk who proceeded to go up and "break it up" or in other words slap them on the wrist instead of kicking them out. We should have just called the cops instead.... Well, after it broke up, they were all back around 3 a.m. or so. Got no damn sleep. You'll see from my other reviews, my wife and I are pretty easy going but this trip SUCKED and I feel seriously ripped off of $500 for our 3 night staycation to Key West. We will NEVER go back here!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for Key West!”
Reviews.Author: Nikc84
Reviews.Content: Having been to Key West before, we knew the island well. We really did not mind what part of the island we stayed at. We used Priceline and spent $80 a night. The hotel is located on the far end of the island (near the bridge to Stock Island). It is only a 15 minute scooter drive or maybe 10 minute car ride to the "action" part of Key West. We didn't mind though. If you are looking to be in an area where you are only biking or walking, I wouldn't recommend here. We had a scooter so to us, it did not matter. You are very close to grocery stores and the chain stores from the Travelodge. The staff, especially Erin (manager) and Ann-Marie are super friendly. We originally had a bit of trouble in our original room. Nothing too major, but I called the front desk and both Erin and Ann-Marie were more than accommodating and understanding! We were upgraded to a suite since they did not have any other rooms left. Both rooms were very clean and had all of the necessities you need (hairdryer, iron, safe, bath and body works shampoos/soaps). The economy room had a bed, tv, nightstand, table and chair. These rooms do not have views of the ocean. The suite was just great! We couldn't have been more pleased! Our ocean view room had a full washer/dryer, oven, refrigerator, microwave...etc with all of the items you would need (like dishes, silverware...etc). It had a bedroom, many closets, kitchen, dining area, and bathroom. We were very pleased. The pool area at the hotel lacked anything fancy. I found that it needed to be cleaned more than it was. It was very warm and also had a hot tub. Continental breakfast was nice and was included. It is a small area and can get busy though. It included your basic items like cereal, apples, oatmeal, pastries, muffins, bagels, coffee, juices, and a waffle maker. It was overall very nice and clean. The lobby included a computer you could use for free, however, it was old and could not open a lot of webpages. The elevator at the hotel was probably one of the slower elevators I have experienced. This is somewhat annoying! Overall, I would recommend this hotel. Especially if you are familiar with the island! For the suite, I would give it 5 stars. However, when looking at our original room that we did pay for, I would give it 4 stars. Overall, what a tremendous value: we would probably stay here again. The staff was great and really made the experience nice.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: yoboricua
Reviews.Content: Cudos!! If anyone is looking to spend a few days in Key West, I would recommend the Travelodge Suites. The location was great, close to the stores, restaurants and a few miles from Duval St. The employees were very professional. If I every return to Key West I will definitely stay at the Travelodge Suites. Jenny, GA

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for Key West.”
Reviews.Author: wab427
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights, and we were very pleased with the price since accommodations are expensive in general in Key West. The staff was friendly and helpful, and the room was very clean. There is no refrigerator or microwave, but they provide a hair dryer. The motel is very close to downtown, and it is an easy commute with your car. Parking is available downtown, but it is not free. Look for private lots that charge $10 a day.

Reviews.Title: “Love it, Love it!!!!”
Reviews.Author: adienikk
Reviews.Content: Ok the ubication is not close r of the historic part and Duval, but, its the only hotel that have a nice and beautiful Gulf VieW!!! The service incredible, or two rooms suites, full kitchen is CLEAN!!! no dust, nothing!!! The front desk, Ann-Marie, she is the best, the pool is nice. Very closer to IHOP, Dennys, Publix ( if you go with the family is the best choice) the continental breakfast is cool, small dinning area but cozy!!!! Ve return in September and one week in the next summer.

Reviews.Title: “25th Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: gostewart
Reviews.Content: We love this Hotel the view is to died for and the hotel is very clean and the staff are wonderful . We wanted to celebrate in Key West not in town it's just far away that you can rent scooters or bike and get into town. The One bedroom suite is great with a cooking area and washer and dryer and all that you would want to be comfortable .Staff offers extra towels and anything that is needed to make you happy .. Enjoying you stay is what there motto is and we can't wait til Dec we have already made reservations ..

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad”
Reviews.Author: beachlover1215
Reviews.Content: Continental breakfast ok. Good location. Bay front. Room clean but small. About the least expensive decent hotel in Key West. Would probably stay again if we ever go back, but would really like beachfront in one of the nicer hotels or resorts.

Reviews.Title: “Only stay here if you need a roof and not much more.”
Reviews.Author: Caboy316
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for our long vacation because it seemed to strike the right balance between price and good reviews. We don't have terribly lofty expectations, and didn't plan to be there for anything other than sleep. Even then, this hotel was a bit of a failure. They didnt make up our room after the first night until we called around 5pm the next day. We reserved a month in advance and were still given the room by the elevator where we heard EVERY coming and going, including a 3am fistfight between a couple. The location is more trouble for getting to Duval than it looks. And lastly, the showers were a pathetic dribble of scalding or frigid water. On the plus side, the front desk staff is friendly, though not overly flexible in booking, and the free breakfast was decent. Next time we'll pay the little extra to get a real hotel, because this one was a joke.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs!!! Mold and Mildew caused allergies!!! White socks turned black!!!”
Reviews.Author: RienDeRien
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed during mid-June for 2 nites. First had to switch the room for allergy attacks from strong mold and mildew odor in the entire unit. Stayed in the second room with sunken bed for less allergy attack. Got bitten by bed bugs. This was the VERY FIRST TIME we got bitten by bed bugs!!! I travel a lot but was never bitten by bed bugs so I kinda totally ignored any recent news or information related to bed bugs and became a victim of them - thought they were mosquito bites but they are still spreading as I type this review and research confirms it's bed bug bite!!! Had to sanitize entire stuff we took for travel. The carpet on the floor turned our white socks and clean bare feet into black, we had to keep shoes on. We will never stay in any Travelodge again after this horrible experience.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: SantinoBuenosAires
Reviews.Content: Our family were here past May. I strongly recommend this hotel. It is clean, great breakfast included and the staff was very helpful. I am sure that we would go back again with pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for the Price”
Reviews.Author: mrsprincess603
Reviews.Content: Paid $80 per night through Priceline and was happy when I found out how much the rooms normally go for. Had a room, not a suite. All the staff was very friendly and accomodating. The pool was a little dirty and the hot tub only worked randomly, but that is my only complaint. We were on the 3rd floor, so the chickens were not an issue. Free parking was awesome, and there is a bus stop right across the street that you can take to Duval for $2. If I can get the room on the cheap again, we will be back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Shoot the Roosters”
Reviews.Author: rauchous
Reviews.Content: Firstly the hotel was very nice I got a good deal thru Expidia at $110 P/N... no it was not a suite and the room was not large but was very comfortable and very clean .. There was onsite parking and the location was OK for me but you do need a car to get around to Duval Street and the beaches. I found all the staff to be FANTASTIC and very friendly and helpful ,,,there is free Internet in the lobby for guests and Wi Fi thoughout the breakfast was basic and Included in the tariff. There is a very large pool with towels provided RE THE ROOSTERS Don't blame the owners when you get woken up a 4 am by a horny rooster they don't own then, as I found out Chickens and Roosters are protected on the Island and roam free EVERYWHERE and they are VERY protected by law. So it wouldn't matter where you stayed where will be roosters roamy. Would I stay again YES If the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Huge suites”
Reviews.Author: TwoSue
Reviews.Content: We were staying one night in Key West during the week before Easter and I was trying to find a room for less than $200. I ended up paying $190 (with taxes) for a king suite at Travelodge. When I checked again a month later, the rooms had skyrocketed to over $300, so I was glad I reserved early! Although the hotel is old and right on the highway, the rooms were huge! Our kitchen had a full-sized refrigerator, dishwasher, washer/dryer and kitchen table. It was clean enough. We hit breakfast at the end of its open time and it was pretty sparse. I would recommend it for a one-nighter to the keys. We drove down to Duval Street and had a pleasant evening.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but nothing spectacular”
Reviews.Author: Kat48128
Reviews.Content: This hotel sits right ON S Roosevelt so all you hear is traffic day and night. If you're looking to save money you can get a basic room for 108$/night or a 1st floor suite with a view of S Roosevelt and the ocean for 188/night. Rooms were clean but outdated and worn, pool and hot tub were nice but, again, sit right next to the main road so all you hear is traffic. There were also several roosters running around the grounds and they crowed about every 10 minutes from sun up to sun down. Friends of ours rented a 2 bedroom condo across from Smathers beach for about 150$/night which was much nicer and quieter.

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: marya48
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights in 2 bedroom suite. Everything was clean and very comfortable. Pleasant helpful staff. Was ten minute drive out of Key West , so was very reasonable price. Really enjoyed our stay,

Reviews.Title: “Suite was sweet!”
Reviews.Author: goshan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night during our weekend trip to Key West. I booked through Hotwire and expected two rooms. Instead, what we got was a suite, and it was definitely sweet! The suite had two levels: the rooms are huge on with 2 bedrooms on the upper level and living room on the lower level. There were balconies on both levels. After putting kids to sleep, we stayed on the balcony relaxing and enjoying gentle Key West breeze. In the morning we didn't want to leave, although we had to... The location is a bit far from the center (basically it's on the northeastern side of the island), but the parking was free and plentiful, and there is a nearby supermarket to stock up. Overall, I would definitely recommend this hotel for your stay in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “The suite was perfect for us!”
Reviews.Author: SZQ
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from our Key West vacation and chose the Travelodge as it was an excellent value for the suite. Our suite had a large kitchen, dining area, living room, bedroom, and a nice balcony. Although it has the dishes, etc. for cooking, it was not practical to cook there as we did not have any cooking basics (salt/pepper/etc.) and did not want to buy these things for our 3 night stay. Also, there is no restaurant "right next door" so you will need to drive or take a taxi for dinner. The complimentary breakfast in the lobby was nice, and included hot waffles and cereal. The front desk staff was very helpful with my questions. If we go to Key West again, we would probably stay closer to town to be near the dining and bars.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms were huge”
Reviews.Author: balazij
Reviews.Content: Tarvelodge has suites that are bigger than some Condo's I have stayed at. The continental breakfast in the morning is great

Reviews.Title: “Small room without window, nice hotel but not close to the center”
Reviews.Author: Joyaa
Reviews.Content: We stayed there only 1 night so I think we got one of the worst rooms, without windows and in front of the lift. The hotel is nice with jacuzzi next to the pool (the water was really really hot and it was impossible to change the temperature!). Parking big and free. Is not close to the center.

Reviews.Title: “Don't GO”
Reviews.Author: ROBBJOHN
Reviews.Content: Booked 3 nts at this hotel as the website said it was newly renovated. I thought the rooms were renovated but guess it was just the structure. The room was very small and had one window that you would need a chair to stand on to look out. We spent one night and the bed was not too bad for comfort but we did not wanted to spend another night here. We left and spent a 2nd night in a B&B which was lovely, comfortable and not much more money than the Travelodge.

Reviews.Title: “first time at key west”
Reviews.Author: Frank1700
Reviews.Content: Very nice place for the money.breakfast was okay,rooms were clean. Room was small but okay for sleeping. Staff was always helpfull.Hope to be back again

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay for Fantasy Fest”
Reviews.Author: Tactical357
Reviews.Content: Staff was great and very helpful. The Cleanliness was marked down because they were in the middle of remodeling and the concrete dust was all over the place to include the cars in the parking lot. The Suites are the way to go. It is basically a converted 2 bedroom condo with a fully kitchen with dish washer, stackable washer/dryer and a small kitchen nook.The room has it own air conditioner and hotwater heater The only difference for the one bedrom suite is one front bedroom has been isolated from the suite and converted into a single room. These single room is bacically a size of a normal bedroom with a queen bed, small closet, and a bathroom. Its not the Hyatt but it is a great value for the money. Already got my room for 2011 Fantasy Fest. There is a bus stop next to the hotel. Cabs are reseasonable priced to get to Duval Street for the festival.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: MLThomas04
Reviews.Content: We stayed in 3 suites & 1 room over Christmas & New Years. The staff could not have been nicer or more knowledgeable. The accommodations were more than adequate, nothing luxurious, but I felt better than we expected. It seemed to us that the pool was heated as we were able to use it and the weather was chilly for several days. A bit far to "Old Town" but we adjusted.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable accommodations on the island”
Reviews.Author: kcgreyhound
Reviews.Content: If you want ambiance, stay elsewhere. If you want a bed and a shower to enjoy Key West, this is a viable option. The location is not close enough to the action to walk (though we did it once to test this theory). Nearby you can rent scooters or bikes which will take care of your Key needs. As for this hotel, it is sufficient, and doesn't surpass nor fall short of what I expected from the Travelodge brand. The bedding was clean, the bathroom was clean, and the room was quite comfortable (though small). I wouldn't hesitate to book a room here if you could get it for a good rate. I booked through Priceline, and I got a very nice rate for New Years, a very busy time. The breakfast was simple continental fare, minus any fruit options. The resident roosters will make you feel like it's morning at 1:15 a.m. They don't know that they're supposed to cock-a-doodle as the sun comes up...so they do it all night. Again, if you don't mind taxi, scooter or bike to get to town, this is a way to save a buck or two on a very expensive island.

Reviews.Title: “you get more then what you expect ...”
Reviews.Author: gotayj
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at travel lodges before I knew what to expect ....but when I stayed at this one I was shock room was big living room huge bathroom could of been a good size computer room ...there is a rooster there that i fed every day first thing well cause he woke me up lol ....I enjoyed it you get your bang for your buck there

Reviews.Title: “Fantasy Fest”
Reviews.Author: YardDawg14
Reviews.Content: We choose Travelodge based on price and the majority of reviews that mentioned room cleanliness. The reviews were spot on. We choose a Standard Queen room, it was small but provided enough room for my wife and I. Although the decor seems a little dated, the most important thing to us was that it was clean. Both the room and the bathroom were very well maintained; in fact the bathroom was in such good shape I would be led to believe it had been remodeled within the past year. It would have been nice to have a higher quality TV, but we really weren't in the room that often. We never visited the pool so I can't speak to it. And the breakfast provided each morning was more than adequate. Only real negative was the morning wake up call provided courtesy of the multiple native roosters that call that call the Travelodge home. Overall the Travelodge was a good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: ToddCF
Reviews.Content: Lovely Ocean View Room with 2 bedrooms and 2 baths, for a GREAT PRICE!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Clean Hotel for the Price”
Reviews.Author: snr1016
Reviews.Content: Stayed there July 5th for a few days and we had a room with a full kitchen. We had our young sons with us so wanted to save $$ by doing our own food sometimes. Kitchen was clean but a little dated but that is not a big deal. And we had a wahser and dryer in there too. These amenities are rare unless you are staying at a condo rental, and those can be very pricey. Elevator was giving a little trouble but no one got stuck or anything and hotel is not on the beach. Had heated pool, jacuzzi, free parking, free WiFi in every room and continental breakfast included. A lot of the other hotels charge you for parking on top of feeing you to death! This is not a 4 star hotel but I did not expect that for the price. I would definitely stay at this hotel again and recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Well looked after”
Reviews.Author: Andy T
Reviews.Content: The Travelodge in Key West is on the Gulf side of the island. Although there are no beaches on this side of the island and it's a short drive to Downtown, it's totally worth staying here! The staff were more than amazing - their customer service is fantastic! Always friendly and always willing to help! The rooms were a bit small and dated, but otherwise very clean and well kept. The only negative thing we found with the room is that it was a bit noisy in the early morning hours. Two nights in a row we heard loud music and people yelling from somewhere around the hotel. We could never figure out exactly where it was coming from though. The pool area was beautiful but a bit noisy as it bordered one of the main streets on the island. It had plenty of chairs and space for all guests, a tiki bar and a hot tub. You get a great view of the Gulf of Mexico from the pool, as well as some beautiful sunsets! The front desk offers complimentary pool towels if you need them. There was also a family of roosters living nearby that came to visit the guests everyday. They were completely harmless and very cute! There was free parking for guests, as well as a free breakfast every morning which was well stocked with all your essential breakfast needs. There is also free Wireless internet in all rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't recommend”
Reviews.Author: chrisngary
Reviews.Content: I will start by saying that Key West is a very touristic area, therefore everything is "pricey" but this hotel in our opinion was way overpriced for what we got. One more thing I will say before I go on is that my review is in no way exagerated. Our room was so small (room 326). The window was not at eye level, it was way too high and basically useless. The bed was so unconfortable and it made this awful noice every time one of us moved and got in or out of it. I may have got 3 hours sleep. I can't believe this hotel still had this bed in a rented room! The one positive thing I can say about our room is that it was very clean. The location was right along the main drag coming into Key West. The free continental breakfast was average, like any other I've experienced. The pool area was nice but could have used a bit of TLC. Would I stay there again? Not unless I had no choice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, Wonderful Visit!”
Reviews.Author: ddjgarden
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 days at the Travelodge and it was so wonderful. The grounds are so well kept. Clean and manicured. Our room was spotless upon our arrival and the staff kept it so clean every day. Nichole who is the manager was so friendly and seems to have a great relationship with her staff. Valerie, the evening desk clerk was so helpful and gave us great ideas of local places to eat and each one was wonderful. The pool was spotless. I just can't say enough. It's located out of the hustle and noise of downtown with a beautiful view of the Bay. I will stay there again and tell everyone who wants advice on a place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, huge room options”
Reviews.Author: 1helpfultraveler
Reviews.Content: Since we are a family with 3 teens, we like a lot of room, this hotel offers a 3-bedroom, 2 bath option. We had plenty of room. Hotel offers continental breakfast, or we could cook in room since we had full kitchen. Room set up is unusual, unfortunately there is a lot of wasted space, tons of closet space, but why? The spiral staircase to upstairs could be a challenge for young kids, and with a heavy suitcase, odd that it can sleep 8, but only has kitchen table for 4 and bar stools for 2. We only eat breakfast and snacks here so that wasn't a problem, just a crazy design.We has a nice gulf view from main level patio. The addition of in-room washer/dryer was helpful with wet beach clothes. For families, this is great, you use hotel as base of operation so you can explore the Keys. None of the hotels have much beach access, those downtown can be noisy with Duval St crowd, those hotels near airport listen to flights coming and going so I thought this place fit our needs.

Reviews.Title: “if you like very small rooms...”
Reviews.Author: frequent_trvlr75
Reviews.Content: Standard rooms are roughly 12ft x 12ft with literally no views through the small window. Ours looked out to a wall. The door jams have no insulation so light, and more importantly NOISE, comes in all around the door all day and all night. Our bed was the most uncomfortable I have slept on in years, and really seemed more like a double and not a queen as advertized. We asked to be moved, and were told we could, but all the standard rooms are the same small size. It was a very bad value even at priceline's half price rate.

Reviews.Title: “you get what you pay for, but it is a good deal”
Reviews.Author: kastela
Reviews.Content: probably one of the cheapest places on Key West, but rooms are clean and quiet. you will need a car

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel - not worth the money. Should be a 1 star”
Reviews.Author: ktwalmsley
Reviews.Content: This hotel is listed as a 3 star and our room was listed as a queen but it is awful. The tiny window looked out on an outdoor corridor beyond which was the car park. The bed was basically a large single and the room tiny. Every morning we were woken by loud engine sounds, garbage trucks and turbines. We had prepaid 3 days but checked out on the 2nd as couldn't deal with it any more. When I tried to get the hotel to add rewards points to my wyndams account - the front desk told me they couldn't 'cos you booked through orbitz - so orbitz gets your money - so you don't get points'. I'm pretty sure travelodge still gets my money I told them'. 'No' - they said 'orbitz gets it'. I mean - what????

Reviews.Title: “A Great way to spend Thanksgiving”
Reviews.Author: floridaLeila
Reviews.Content: We arrived Thanksgiving Eve. The front desk employees were very freiendly, helpful and accomadating. I have read negative reviews on trip advisor about this place and was a little worried...but it was great. The rooms was clean, free light breakfast good. We called down before the time to see if we could get some coffee and Dean @ the front desk let us every morning. I would go back. We have stayed at alot of places @ Key West and for the price this is good. If you are looking for fancy and paying the big bucks look elsewhere. However , if you want to save some cash for other things. This is your place. I bid $70.00 on PriceLine a it took my bid....nice. We rented bikes to ride to get around...just ask at the front desk and they will call and have them delivered.

Reviews.Title: “Problems at first, but overall acceptable”
Reviews.Author: Anthonyra456
Reviews.Content: Me and my brother took a little "getaway" for a few days and stayed at the Travelodge. At first, at check-in I gave my name and after some searching, the hotel states that they have already checked in somebody in my name. They give us another room but when we enter we find one double bed. Not wanting to cuddle with my brother, we asked to upgrade for 30 more a night. This room was extremely spacious and had a balcony facing the Gulf. You do need to have a car or some other form of transportation to get to the heart of Key West which was a bother so this will not be a place I will stay again. If you prefer to stay away from the hussle and bussle of the downtown area, this is good enough.

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel in a beautiful place”
Reviews.Author: tomawok
Reviews.Content: I'm just amazed about this place, it's just a peace of paradise. The hotel is just perfect to visit the island and get a break in such a beautiful place. Hotel is comfortable, just enough to sleep and get fresh for the next day. Staff friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel not bad, just don't expect a friendly staff or think that it is close to downtown”
Reviews.Author: hmoontraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for mu honeymoon. I have to say I am a bit disappointed. My main concern is not the hotel itself. The staff was just plain rude here. I asked for information about finding a cab, and the guy looked at me like I was a nuisance. I find rude employees unacceptable in the hospitality industry. I do not plan on staying here again solely based on that. There are many hiotels right around the area in the same price range. I plan to stay somewhere else next time to see if they appreciate my business more.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay with a group of friends (or for a family)”
Reviews.Author: MrsO531
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to KW w/ 4 friends. We waited to long to book a hotel and couldn't find anything decently priced. We booked a three bedroom king suite which allowed us all to stay together and save some money. Overall the hotel was good. The best thing is the rooms were big, it was like being in a condo, not a hotel. It was convienient to have a full kitchen. Also, we had two balconies! One looked out to the water. The worst thing was the location. The island is small and I would have prefered to be closer to Duval Street so we could just walk everywhere we went, but we were a good distance away. If we went to KW again with a group of people we would stay here. If it were just my husband and myself we would go to a B&B by Duval.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel OK, don't be afraid”
Reviews.Author: Koz6886
Reviews.Content: We took the Key West Express and this hotel had a discount rate with the boat company so we stayed. The hotel is a little old but clean. All we did was sleep and shower there. We had a "standard" room and it had a great view of the parking lot. But it was OK, as I said all we did was sleep there. We rented a scooter from the company recommended by the hotel and that was great. The scooter was not brand new it had some scratches and broken parts, but it started right up every time and got us from place to place for 3 days (plus we weren't worried about scratching it ourselves). My only warning is be aware the standard room only has one bed. Other than that all was good.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value - due for Renos”
Reviews.Author: drknows
Reviews.Content: Six of us stayed in one of the "Penthouse Suites" in January of 2009. The Good: The suites are spacious and the hotel staff does it's best to keep the rooms clean. Internet was wireless and fast. The doors and windows facing the highway are double paned and keep out most of the traffic noise. The pool was warm and clean. The front desk and cleaning staff were friendly and helpful. Good location - 5 mins. from Duval. Free parking. Reasonable price. The bad: This is an old hotel and in need of major room renos: The carpets are worn and the appliances and furniture are in need of replacement, The spiral stairs are quite wobbly and have frayed carpets and broken coverings on the hand rails. The lighting fixtures are old flourescents which tend to flicker and buzz

Reviews.Title: “Travelodge Key West Florida”
Reviews.Author: oldtravellerFlorida
Reviews.Content: Room was satisfactory. Needed a car for downtown area as bus service was erratic and difficult to find timetable and location of stops. Breakfast was about average for this type of motel.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: jetlagged3
Reviews.Content: A good clean hotel with knowledgable and freindly staff. A small breakfast with coffee muffins and Bagels. I am now an Englishman who adores a toasted Bagel and cream cheese ! The pool area is very clean and also has a nice bubble pool. The rooms are clean, spacious and comfortable. The location of the Hotel could be deemed as a little troublesome if you do not have a car, as it is some distance for Duval Street (the main shopping and dining Street). There is a public bus but the Hotel mentioned that is was not the most reliable of services and it was a long journey (not sure why ?). A taxi from the Hotel to Duval cost between 15 and 20 dollars which is not a major issues if only staying a few nights. One can hire bicycles but after a few cold beers the ride hope could take an eternity !

Reviews.Title: “Poor Location, tired hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ady_Manchester
Reviews.Content: The travelodge is located about 3-4 miles from Duval street, which is an issue, as there is no regular transportation into the "town". This meant that to get into the sights, you needed to either drive or walk along the main highway. The hotel itself is in need of a refit - the room we had did not have a proper window, which was fine as we only slept in the room and didn't spend any time in it. Everything just looks a bit old and in need of a bit of decoration. Breakfast was fine and the staff were friendly and efficient. The hotel was adequate but just really nothing special, particularly for the price, which was the same as a much nicer hotel we stayed at in Manhatten!

Reviews.Title: “Wondeful Stay...!!”
Reviews.Author: HGinNJ
Reviews.Content: this is the first Travelodge I have stayed at - what a wonderful, clean comfortable place to stay in! The staff were very helpful and quick to respond to any requests we had. We stayed in a 1br suite, it was very clean and had a great view of the gulf. The pool and jacuzzi were great and not too busy - which we liked after all the craziness downtown! They have made a great effort to keep with island feel with the landscaping and to hear the rustling of the palm trees was the most relaxing thing after a hectic day walking and shopping. There are three bus stops within walking distance of the hotel (one which is right outside) so it's cheaper than paying for cabs or car rental - however it may take a little time to familiarize with the different bus routes!! I would absolutely recommend this property to everyone who wants a good middle ground affordable, clean place to stay. Kudos to Nicol who manages this hotel and her staff, we will absolutely stay here again and again Helene in NJ

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: Smudger0122
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Travelodge from 11th July to 14th July 2008. We had a clean room which had a double bed,cable TV and coffee making facilites. The bathroom was clean and had a hairdryer. The reception area is small and clean, also the front desk guys are very friendly. Breakfast is a selection of cereals, muffins, bagels and tea/coffee. This is held in the same area as the reception/check in. There is also a computer in the reception area for free internet access. The pool area is clean and has an extremely hot jacuzzi there as well. May we suggest eating at the Hard Rock restaurant on Duval Street, which is inside what appears to be an old wooden house. Also a snack in Sloppy Joes is an experience. Fort Zachory Beach is a must. Be aware Sun loungers and umberellas are expensive to rent here. Think I paid $25 for the day. But there is a cafe that provides some good lunches. Mallory Square to watch the sunset. Picture at Southernmost Point.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: MichaelPalin
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Travelodge & Suites whilst visiting the southern Keys for a few days. We picked this hotel simply because it had appeared on Expedia at a discounted rate whilst we were up in Fort Lauderdale the day before we left to head down there. Key West is expensive (relative to the Florida mainland) for hotels, so the Travelodge suddenly became excellent value and gained our custom. They were resurfacing the car park when we were there, so parking was limited (and this may have been why they were offering the discounted rate), but for the three nights we stayed, parking wasn't a problem. The room was nothing special; small and functional describes it well. Then again, what are you looking for? We were just wanting somewhere to put our heads down at night - we were out every day sightseeing, so function was more important than form. It was also clean, which is something I do think is important. Breakfast was not substantial, but it was free, and it'll keep you going for a few hours. As pointed out on an earlier review, the elevator has no AC. That's true, and it was also glass and fixed to the outside of the hotel which didn't help to keep the climate down. But then we didn't spend much time in the elevator! The hotel is quite a way from the main attractions of Key West, and walking to Duvall Street is not really an option. That said, I thought that was a good thing. It can get quite noisy in that part of town at night. On the other hand, if you are a Scuba diver, then the superb Dive Key West Inc is only about half a mile along the road.

Reviews.Title: “Great Inexpensive (for KW) hotel”
Reviews.Author: KevOpelli
Reviews.Content: New owners in 2006, and it is rising from the dead. Much better than previous owners, poollside bar open again. Rooms were clean, staff friendly. Not a luxary hotel, but definetly a great value and would stay again, in fact I'm already booked for the same time this year. Be advised the elevator is does NOT have AC, it gets hot or there are a lot of steps to be climbed for the upper f;loors.

Reviews.Title: “Terribly run down, poor location”
Reviews.Author: coasterphil
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't recommend this hotel to any other travelers to Key West. Its extremely overpriced; I wouldn't have even paid half as much as I did to stay there again. The location isn't great. Its pretty much as far from Duval and the activities in Old Town as you can get, which I admittedly knew going in. There was a shopping center within easy walking distance so that may be a plus to some. The room itself was horrible. We had a 3 bedroom suite, and while it was big it looked and smelled like it was 30 years old. The stench almost knocked us off our feet when we got in. Other problems included no blankets for the sleeper sofa, garbage all around the room, exposed wiring, staircase to the upper level shaking violently when used (to the point where I truly feared that someone would break it during the weekend), and ants running across the counter tops in the kitchen. The breakfast left a lot to be desired, which shouldn't have been much of a surprise based on the size of the reception area. The service was poor overall, both housekeeping and check-in. Overall, I would never stay at the hotel again and would recommend others to keep away as well. Unless this is the only option, find somewhere else. It doesn't offer anything special, and the rates aren't something to get excited about either.

Reviews.Title: “Over Priced”
Reviews.Author: Triplady2264
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean and room was a good size.. You could hear alot of noise while in the room. When in the pool area traffic was very loud. Contential breakfast was not early enough and not much of a selection. Only one elevator for the staff and customers. Not enough towels for two people.

Reviews.Title: “A Repeat Customer”
Reviews.Author: harleyva
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel several times over the last few years. My last stay Jul 06 was as good as it gets. The rooms had been remodelded and were clean. My wife and son and I all enjoyed the pool and hot tub. Having been to the keys several times for the money this is the best place to stay. The manager is always helpful and I will be staying here again on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: HDTRAVELER
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Key West, Florida on 4/26 - 4/28/2006 and this hotel was wonderful. The view of the gulf was directly across the street. The staff was very helpful with places to eat, things to do and anything to make your stay perfect. We wanted to rent scooters and they called and got them delivered for us. They also came to pick them up the day we checked out. Scooters is the best way to get around and enjoy the sights of Key West. We had a one bedroom suite with a full kitchen and laundry. The balcony overlooked the pool and hot tub and the gulf. The balcony was adjoining the living room and the bedroom. I can't say enough good about this hotel and staff.

Reviews.Title: “dont know about the reservations, but from my experiance it was great.”
Reviews.Author: speedotorpedo
Reviews.Content: 3 and a half stars i would give it really, not quite 4, only because it did appear a little run down and neglected, and the first thing you see after the lobby check in, is the massive parking garage, which is undesirable to walk through every time you enter and exit the hotel. The elevator seemed a little old and the pool a little neglected (the bar looked like it haddent been touched in decades) but the pool was very nice, and provided a nice alternative place to tan (a little more quiet then the bustling beaches nearby) I really cant comment on the reservation situation, as many peopel on this site have complained about, since I was not involved in that process, but for my experiance, it was a great stay. I stayed in one of the bigger 3rd floor suites (with a balcony and all) It was so big it was as if we rented a 2 level appartment! 2 bathrooms, a sufficient kitchen, laundry and a windey staircase. The front desk consisted of your typical key west folk (if ya know what i meannnnnnn...) they were however, very very nice and helpfull to me, but i can easily see how they can come across as provocative to others. Personally I had no problem with this hotel, its location to the beach was great and is very close to dubal street.

Reviews.Title: “Suite was like a nice size apartment”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When we drove up I was a little concern because the outside lamp post were broken or only had one light. The hotel looked like it had just undergone a paint job and in fact they were painting inside the covered garage. We arrived earlier than the check in time and a suite was ready but it was on the second floor. We were not to pleased about this as the main street was right outside and we felt like there would be constant traffic noise. We asked if there were any others available on the 4th floor, the highest, but they only have suites on second and third. The third floor suites were not ready to check in but we opt to wait, since we only had time to kill. I must say by the time that we got back, our suite was ready and I was pleasantly surprised. We stayed in #305. I probably would have liked something a little more centered but this was still a nice view. There is a large patio from the living room to the bedroom. However, I must say even being on the 3rd floor the patio doors are so thin that you do pick up alot of traffic noise. The room was very spacious and well done. You had a full size kitchen with washer & dryer, a dining area, living room. I really liked the seperation of the bedroom, vanity and bathroom. Plenty of closet space, you really could just live there. My only minor complaint is that they need to update their coffee machine, as it only makes one cup at a time. For a room that large, there most likely will be more than one person staying there. The fridge was a household size and they provided dishes for cooking. We found the continental breakfast just okay. The pool was a nice size, well kept and the jacuzzi was hot with large towels to dry off with. I have ten years of hotel experience and I must say that this could be a very nice property and I see that they were making improvements. However, they need to start with their front desk staff afterall, first impressions are lasting impressions. I did not see anyone dress professionally but sloppy. I understand this is Florida and it does get hot, but they seem to come to work like they just fell out of bed. You couldn't tell who actually worked there or if they were a guest. Seemed like the housekeeping or maintenance people were properly identifiable with a logo shirt on. I was not impressed by the staffs non chalant attitudes and it certainly is true that you dress the way you feel. My overall stay was good and I would stay there again but hopefully the next time the staff will be properly attired.

Reviews.Title: “They cancelled my reservation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I reserved a suite at this hotel. When I showed up, they said I cancelled my reservation. I never cancelled my reservation. I think they cancelled my reservation because they did not want to honor the low rate I reserved it for. I wrote letters and called Travelodge and they never returned my calls or tried to make it right with me. I was very panicked arriving in Key West on a Saturday evening with my room reservation cancelled. They didn't even care.

Reviews.Title: “Way Overpriced!”
Reviews.Author: Arielitoll
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my dad on April 2002. As you enter you will walk in a very nicely decorated lobby. As you get to your room you will not see what you expected. The pictures make it look as if ALL the rooms had balconies. That is not true, our room did not have an ocean view nor did it even have a balcony. There is only one elevator to take you to the rooms. The rooms are in okay shape. We requested two beds and they only gave us one. We enced up paying about $148 dollars for the extremely small room. When we arrived to our room towards the evening we found a towel that had wears and tears all over it. We went to the front desk and they immediately gave us a good one. The location of the hotel is very good. It is right by the highway and next to several restaurants. Also, I would reccomend staying at the Radisson next door which is an extremely nice property in Key West. I think they are both the same price. ALSO, the parking of the hotel is not too bad... There is garage parking on the G-level of the hotel. Personally, I thought this hotel was alright. God Bless.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff- great view”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Travelodge and Suites in Key West eventhough it's reviews were not the best. I booked through Hotels and had not realized that I had booked a room withonly one bed in it!(We were 4 people). After realizing that the room was too small I went down tothe front desk to speak to the manager. She gave me a free upgrade at a blink of an eye. She not only laughed with us about the whole situation but also guided us to the best "locals' restaurants". I will be staying again. It really makes a difference when there's someone "human" atthe fornt desk to help you out!

Reviews.Title: “Don't let the reviews scare you!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel despite the reviews because it had 3 separate bedrooms, plus a kitchen and living room and dining room and a washer and dryer en suite. We couldn't be happier--the accomadations were clean, well maintained and the staff was ever so helpful. Go for the suites, not the rooms. Its a ten minute drive to the old town. There are really no swimming beaches at Key West, but the view from the hotel over the water is quite lovely. We even did a sunset from our back balcony!

Reviews.Title: “BAD BAD BAD”
Reviews.Author: jcacioli
Reviews.Content: This place needs to be torn down and rebuilt! Lets start with the check in. The "help wanted front desk" sign should have been the first warning. It seemed nobody actually works at the front desk, just whoever might be around. The elevator plain out smelled. The room (2 bedroom suite) was a reck. It was nice to open the door and find one of the hotel employees sleeping on my coach! He quickly apologized and left. The front door looked like it had been kicked in not too long ago and locking it was a chore. The kitchen was disgusting, everything was broken and dirty. Small little bugs (like flee's) crawled around the phone and stove. The carpet was dirty and smelled. The furniture had seen one too many spring breaks. The baths were useable but needed lots of work. And the smell of must/ mold was everywhere downstairs. The only redeeming quality was the view from the balcony. This place needs big time improvement, until it happens STAY AWAY!

Reviews.Title: “Scam/scum artists”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation through Orbitz for a one-night stay Oct. 23. Due to extreme illness, I called the hotel at 4 a.m. Oct. 23 and cancelled the reservation. If you don't cancel before noon on the check-in day, they charge you for the full night stay and around a $50 cancellation fee, instead of $25. I called the hotel again to see how much was being charged to my credit card, and was told to contact Orbitz. No problem. Later that night, after feeling well enough to drive to a friend's house to use their Internet, I contacted Orbitz's customer service, who said, "we have no record of any cancellation." HELLO?! I am waiting for this situation to be resolved, but it seems to me a hotel so unscrupulous and greedy as to "accidentally" lost a cancellation so they can collected more than $200 for a room I never stayed in and a whopper of a cancellation fee, is not a place to do business with .. check out the cute little bed and breakfasts off Duval St. where the proprietors are business people, but they are still honest and not scummy scam artists!!!

Reviews.Title: “What a deal!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place is a dive. When we arrived, our room that we had booked for over three months wasn't even clean. It appeared that someone had just left. No towels, soap, wash cloths etc... The appliances in the "wonderful kitchen" were so worn and filthy dirty we didn't even think of using them. There were doors missing from some of the closets. Most of the light bulbs in the room were burned-out, the smoke detectors had no batteries. The lock on the front was exposed and I could open it with a matchbook cover. The smell of the room was disgusting. When we complained that evening we were told that nothing could be done until the next day. The next morning we went to the front desk to complain and we greeted by the rudest person I have ever met in the service industry. We were basically told that if we didn't like it, they would graciously give us a 50% refund on the first night and we could check-out. Wow! what a deal!! After I told them that I was going to call the fire department, they agreed to move us to another room, which really wasn't a whole lot better. They said they were going to close off that room due to all the problems and should have never put anyone in there. Well, that room wasn't closed long. Someone was in there that afternoon. So, if you want to get ripped off make your reservations today! I still called the fire department when I got back home. I know they inspected and did receive confirmation that some violations were found. I was looking for a "decent" room knowing this wouldn't be the Hilton, but what I got was just a tad better than sleeping in your car. At least the car would have been cleaner.

Reviews.Title: “barely tolerable”
Reviews.Author: marshabell
Reviews.Content: i thought i was getting a good deal through expedia, however, i was quick to realize that $130/night in the off season for this place was a ripoff. i was there 4/30/2004-05/7/2004. i never had to set the alarm because i was awakened every morning by jackhammering at 8am sharp. the worst part was that every other room has a kitchen and you could smell everything they were cooking--our neighbors liked bacon and spicy foods!! the staff was very nice, but unfortunately, could do nothing about the early morning wake up calls and aromas coming through the vents. a couple of days (we stayed 8) they only left us a wash cloth and soap and took all of our towels. i guess we were supposed to air dry those days, but a quick phone call got us more towels. very disappointed to walk around old town and see beautiful victorian bed and breakfast's going for $89 a night. loved key west and will return, but we won't be staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Don't be Fooled!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The pictures looked preety good on the website, but it doesn't show the place is on the highway, skips the decreped condition, and most of all the completly rude desk service. I just could not stand to stay and walked away loosing my money. Horrible!!!

Reviews.Title: “Book this hotel with extreme caution!”
Reviews.Author: SEK1977
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travel to Key West, Florida once every year. We know we must book our room early in order to be able to afford to attend a festival held there as prices for hotel rooms can go up to $400 a night if you wait too long. Three months ago, we booked the Travelodge in Key West via the Travelodge's official website for four nights and got a rate of $143.65 a night for a suite it is more than we usually pay but we thought we'd splurge on a great room this year. We reserved this room with our credit card which we have utilized for the past 10+ years. I received a confirmation number and we started looking for reasonable airfare.We just recently checked our reservation on the Travelodge website and were surprised to find that our reservation had been cancelled. As neither my husband or I cancelled the reservation, and we had never received any notification from the hotel, I called the Travelodge Customer Service number and explained the situation. I was told that the hotel in Key West cancelled the reservation themselves and they would look into the problem and get back to us. We did not hear back from anyone and had to call again twice to finally be told that the hotel in Key West stated that our credit card had been 'declined'. I immediately called our credit card company and they looked into our records but no charge had ever been declined by them in fact when a charge decline is made, a record is kept on the electronic account and the customer is notified via mail neither of which occurred. Our charge card company also told us that no query was ever made by Travelodge and no 'hold' was ever put against our account for this charge as is the usual practice. In other words, the Travelodge in Key West never contacted our credit card company at all.The cost of a suite at the Travelodge in Key West for the dates we had reserved are now $339.15 a night. I truly believe that the hotel did not want to honor our advance rate of $143.65 so they found an excuse to cancel the reservation without any notification to us. If we had not checked ourselves, we would have arrived to find that we had no reservations. So, be very, very careful if you make advance reservations with this hotel .

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. great deal and service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Wonderful stay. Staff was very wonderful. Rooms were enormous! Full size kitchen and beautiful view. Great rates! Manager was a sweetheart. She even helped me take all the luggage out of my room!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible customer service!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It was horrible from beginning to end-the place is old, loud & dirty. The woman at the desk was so rude, and she had her kid running around the reception area. She insisted that we had no reservation, even though it was pre-paid on expedia and confirmed by me two days prior with the manager of the hotel. Long story short, we had to call Travelodge Customer Service to get upgraded to a better room to make up for their rudeness. They also originally sent us to a smoking room (we requested non-smoking) with cigarette butt burns, and it faced a dumpster. Travelodge told us to pay $30 for the upgrade, and we will be reimbursed later. We called customer service two weeks later, and they told us that they are no longer affiliated with that particular hotel, so they would not be reimbursing us. Lovely, huh?

HotelInfo.Name: Travelodge & Suites Key West
HotelInfo.Address: 3444 N Roosevelt Blvd., Key West, FL 33040
